page.title: 06THE CLOUD.
page.content: The Cloud is a hill in the north east of Cheshire just out of Congleton . It is a thousand feet above sea level.Most of the Cloud is scrub land covered with heather and bilberries.At the top there is a triangulation point.The Cloud plantation is mostly evergreen trees.At the top there is also a reservoir ,but this has now been filled in.It used to provide water for the homes in the area.There are several footpaths which people use to walk to the top.From here an excellent view of Cheshire can be seen.At the Cloud side there is a quarry which suppiles sand to Stoke on trent,for pottery. During the Second World War United States Marines trained on the Cloud.
